oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 42 a
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 42 a. Newspaper clipping: WOMAN'S PLACE IS WHERE SHE'S NEEDED.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: WOMAN'S PLACE IS WHERE SHE'S NEEDED. The favorite war cry of the anti-suffragists is "woman's place is in the home." The real truth is that woman's place is wherever she is needed. There was a time when she was needed no where else but in the home (and she stayed there). Does she now do so now altho without the suffrage? If her place is at home, why doesn't she stay there? (the antis included). Possibly because she no longer is obliged to mold candles, make soap, spin and weave cloth as she did in thai golden age of stay-at-home.
